definitions.definition: legally take another's child and bring it up as one's own.
examples: there are many people eager to adopt a baby
synonyms: take care of "we adopted Sasha in 1996"

definitions.definition: take up or start to use or follow (an idea, method, or course of action).
examples: this approach has been adopted by many big banks

definitions.definition: take on or assume (an attitude or position).
choose someone to receive special recognition.
examples: at least 23 people adopted as “prisoners of conscience” remain in jail
synonyms: appoint "the people adopted him as their patron saint"

definitions.definition: formally approve or accept (a report or suggestion).
examples: the committee voted 5–1 to adopt the proposal

definitions.definition: choose (a textbook) as standard or required for a course of study.
choose (an animal) to become a house pet.
examples: the best way to know a dog's traits is to adopt a mature dog

definitions.definition: (of a local authority) accept responsibility for the maintenance of (a road).
